Source code for Features.parametric

# coding: utf-8
""" Created on 23 November 2016. Author: Alexey Goncharov """
import numpy as np


[docs]def parametric_sum(X,w):
    return(X+w)



[docs]def parametrc_quadratic(X,W):
    return(np.multiply(np.power(X,2),W[0])+np.multiply(X,W[1])+W[2])



[docs]def parametrc_qubic(X,W):
    return(np.multiply(np.power(X,3),W[0])+np.multiply(np.power(X,2),W[1])+np.multiply(X,W[2])+W[3])



[docs]def parametric_logarithmic_sigmoid(X,W):
    return( 1. / (W[0]+np.exp(-np.multiply(X,W[1]))))



[docs]def parametric_exponent(X):
    return(np.exp(X))



[docs]def parametric_normal(X,W):
    return(1./(W[0]*np.sqrt(2*np.pi))*np.exp(-np.power(X-W[1],2)/W[0]**2))



[docs]def parametric_multiply(X,w):
    return(np.multiply(X,w))



[docs]def parametric_monomial(X,W):
    return(W[0]*np.power(X,W[1]))



[docs]def parametric_weibul_2(X,W):
    return(W[0]*W[1]*np.power(X,W[1]-1)*np.exp(-W[0]*np.power(X,W[1])))



[docs]def parametric_weibul_3(X,W):
    return(W[0]*W[1]*np.power(X,W[1]-1)*np.exp(-W[0]*np.power(X-W[2],W[1])))



[docs]def parametric_transform(X,w_sum,w_quadratic,w_qubic,w_sigmoid,w_normal,w_multiply,w_monomial,w_weibul2,w_weibul3):
    return(np.hstack((parametric_sum(X,w_sum),parametrc_quadratic(X,w_quadratic),parametrc_qubic(X,w_qubic),
                    parametric_logarithmic_sigmoid(X,w_sigmoid), parametric_exponent(X),
                      parametric_normal(X,w_normal),parametric_multiply(X,w_multiply),parametric_monomial(X,w_monomial),
                     parametric_weibul_2(X,w_weibul2),parametric_weibul_3(X,w_weibul3))))




[docs]def build_henkel_matrix(x,k,p):
    x = np.array(x)
    T = len(x)
    henkel = [x[(T-1):(T-k-1):-1]]
    T=T-p
    while T>=k+1 :
        henkel.append(x[(T-1):(T-k-1):-1])
        T=T-p
    return(np.matrix(henkel))



[docs]def henkel_coefs(x,k,p):
    matrix = build_henkel_matrix(x,k,p)
    Y = matrix[:,0]
    Z = matrix[:,1:]
    return(np.array(np.transpose(np.linalg.lstsq(Z,Y)[0]))[0])



[docs]def SSA(X, k, p):
    return(np.apply_along_axis(henkel_coefs,1,X,k,p))
